item.title: North Korea Reports First Apparent Covid-19 Case
item.description: Kim Jong Un locked down a city near the border with South Korea and required those who had crossed paths with the ill individual to be investigated, examined and quarantined, according to a state-media report.

item.title: Covid's Next Economic Crisis: Developing-Nation Debt
item.description: Emerging economies like Zambia’s, already saddled by years of foreign borrowing, were ill-prepared for the pandemic’s financial pain. “You now have this really massive and all-encompassing shock.”

item.title: After Early Success, South Africa Buckles Under Coronavirus Surge
item.description: Lauded in the early stages of the pandemic for taking decisive steps to limit Covid-19 infections, South Africa is now battling one of the world’s fastest-growing outbreaks that is overpowering hospitals and has caused a dramatic increase in deaths.

item.title: Russian Oil Grab in Libya Fuels U.S.-Kremlin Tensions
item.description: Military contractors linked to the Kremlin have seized control of two of Libya’s largest oil facilities, heightening tensions between Russia and the U.S. over Moscow’s growing footprint in the African nation.

item.title: China's Move to Buy Arctic Gold Mine Draws Fire in Canada
item.description: As world powers seek dominance in the Arctic Circle, opponents of a Chinese company’s purchase of a Canadian gold mine say blocking the deal is in Canada’s national interest.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's Latest Challenge: Containing Covid-19 During the Hajj
item.description: As Saudi Arabia prepares to host the hajj pilgrimage next week, authorities face the unprecedented challenge of balancing their responsibility as stewards of the Muslim world’s most important religious event with the need to curb the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: China's Mighty Yangtze Is Heaving From Rain and the Three Gorges Will Be Tested
item.description: Since June 1, historic floods in China have affected more than 45 million people in 27 provinces; the economic toll is estimated at more than $16.5 billion.
